project_name: Construction of Solid Waste Disposal Facilities Project
objectives: Implement effective solid waste management system in selected areas of the country and contributes to minimize environment pollution and preserve comfortable urban atmosphere for the living residence.; Increase percentage of the recyclable materials.; Decreasing of waste volume being sent to land fill by composting organic waste and saving budget.
main_components:
Establishing four sanitary land filling sites in Medirigiriya in Polonnruwa district and Keerimalai in Jaffna district, Anuradhapura, Hikkaduwa with following facilities;; Storm water retention reservoir
Access roads
Rainwater and underground water drainage facility
Leachate liner system
Leachate collection facility
Leachate treatment facility
Landfill gas collection facility
Administration building and auxiliary facilities.; Storm water retention reservoir; Access roads; Rainwater and underground water drainage facility; Leachate liner system; Leachate collection facility; Leachate treatment facility; Landfill gas collection facility; Administration building and auxiliary facilities.
Project Name: Construction of Solid Waste Disposal Facilities Project
Amount (USD): EDCF Portion - USD 33.5 Mn, GOSL Portion - USD 7.5 Mn
Objective/s: Implement effective solid waste management system in selected areas of the country and contributes to minimize environment pollution and preserve comfortable urban atmosphere for the living residence.; Increase percentage of the recyclable materials.; Decreasing of waste volume being sent to land fill by composting organic waste and saving budget.
Main Component/s:
Establishing four sanitary land filling sites in Medirigiriya in Polonnruwa district and Keerimalai in Jaffna district, Anuradhapura, Hikkaduwa with following facilities;; Storm water retention reservoir
Access roads
Rainwater and underground water drainage facility
Leachate liner system
Leachate collection facility
Leachate treatment facility
Landfill gas collection facility

project_name: Establishment Gampaha College of Technology and Colombo Central Vocational Training Centre Project
objectives: Establish two vocational training centers with modern technological facilities in Gampaha and Colombo for leading of the Sri Lanka vocational training system.
main_components: Providing formal professional education to students with regard to the latest technology and know-how in the selected areas.; Match the labor market requirements in both local and international.; Empower labour force with necessary knowledge and skills; Increase job opportunities for the youth of the country.
executing_agency: Ministry of Skills Development and Vocational Training
Project Name: Establishment Gampaha College of Technology and Colombo Central Vocational Training Centre Project
Amount (USD): EDCF Portion - USD 26.05 Mn, GOSL Portion - USD 5.4 Mn
Objective/s: Establish two vocational training centers with modern technological facilities in Gampaha and Colombo for leading of the Sri Lanka vocational training system.
Main Component/s: Providing formal professional education to students with regard to the latest technology and know-how in the selected areas.; Match the labor market requirements in both local and international.; Empower labour force with necessary knowledge and skills; Increase job opportunities for the youth of the country.
Executing Agency: Ministry of Skills Development and Vocational Training

objectives: Provide safe drinking water to the residents in Mahawa and Polpithigama areas in Kurunegala District; Decreasing the incidence of water born deceases in the project area; Increasing the living conditions of the community; Promoting economic prosperity as preserving the environment through provision of safe drinking water
main_components: Providing adequate pipe born water supply to people in 97 Grama Niladari Divisions; Establishment of water treatment plant at Pothuwewa, construction of three eleveated water towers etc.
executing_agency: Ministry of City Planning and Water Supply
Amount (USD): EDCF Portion - USD 58.155 Mn, GOSL Portion - USD Mn

objectives: Provide safe drinking water to residents in the Ruwanwella area by developing a piped water supply system,; Decrease the drinking water issues and thereby improve the living conditions of the people.
main_components: Establishment of Intake Facility of 4,400 m3/d; Establishment of Water Treatment Plant : 4,000 m3/d; Establishment of Water Storage Reservoir; Establishment of Transmission Line of 110Km approximately; Providing Electronic &mechanical equipment
executing_agency: Ministry of City Planning and Water Supply
Objective/s: Provide safe drinking water to residents in the Ruwanwella area by developing a piped water supply system,; Decrease the drinking water issues and thereby improve the living conditions of the people.

objectives: Provide safe drinking water to a population of about 112,000 people; Cater the Commercial and Industrial water demand of the area; Cater the future water demand of the area which has been assessed as 35000 m3 day in the year 2025; Source improvement and construction of an intake at Ridiyagama tank; Construction of a 17,500m3/day  treatment plant at Koggalla; Ssupply and laying of 45 km of water transmission system; Construction of 4 ground reservoirs and 4 elevated towers; Supply and laying of 400 km long distribution pipe network
implementing_agency: National Water Supply and Drainage Board
executing_agency: Ministry of Water Supply and Drainage

project_name: Improvement of Hatton Nuwara Eliya Road Project
objectives: Rehabilitation the road section between Hatton and Nuwara Eliya to improve  the accessibility to the people living in the area, eliminate traffic congestion and enhance road safety.; Widening and improvement of 35.6 Km long Hatton-Nuwara Eliya road with 2 lane facility; construction of the underpass crossing at Nanuoya railway and Kotagala tunnel
executing_agency: Ministry of Highways and Road Development

main_components: Habarana Grid Substation (2x10MVA transformers replaced with 2x31.5MVA transformers and added 4x33kV feeder bays); Balangoda Grid Substation (2x10MVA transformers replaced with 2x31.5MVA transformers and added 4x33kV feeder bays); Trincomalee Grid Substation (2x10MVA transformers replaced with 2x31.5MVA transformers and added 4x33kV feeder bays); Kiribathkumbura Grid Substation (added 2x132kV transmission line bays)
